ai-ud1.6:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
ai-ud1.6:1.3_0: Now at that time Venerable Mahākassapa was staying in the Pipphali cave.
ai-ud1.6:1.4_0: Then after some time he recovered from that illness.
ai-ud1.6:1.6_0: “Why don’t I enter Rājagaha for alms?”
ai-ud1.6:2.1_0: Now at that time around five hundred deities had committed to Mahākassapa.
ai-ud1.6:2.2_0: But Mahākasspa refused those deities. In the morning, he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Rājagaha for alms.
ai-ud1.6:2.3_0: He went to the streets of the poor, the destitute, and the weavers.
ai-ud1.6:2.4_0: The Buddha saw him wandering for alms in the streets of the poor, the destitute, and the weavers.
ai-ud1.6:3.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud1.6:4.3_0: with defilements ended and flaws purged:
ai-ud1.6:4.4_0: I declare them to be one who follows.”
